theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on caste-specific aging and reproductive monopolization in eusocial insects, linking social structure and lifespan evolution.
Explores aging evolution in cooperative breeders with reproductive queueing and kin selection, emphasizing social structure effects on lifespan.
Models lifespan evolution in eusocial insect populations, highlighting extrinsic mortality reduction and social organization impacts.
Analyzes reproductive monopolization and caste-specific lifespan divergence in eusocial superorganisms, emphasizing colony structure.
Describes fecundity-longevity trade-offs and resource allocation effects on lifespan, including exceptions in eusocial insects.
Focuses on cost of reproduction and environmental modulation of aging, highlighting energy trade-offs shaping lifespan.
Examines reproductive profiles and epigenetic aging, linking reproduction effort to accelerated aging via trade-offs.
Emphasizes reproduction-longevity trade-offs as a core evolutionary mechanism driving aging.
Discusses somatic maintenance versus reproduction trade-offs and intergenerational fitness costs affecting aging.
Highlights evolutionary balance between reproduction timing and aging rates, including heritability of aging.
Traditional evolutionary theory linking juvenile survival and longevity through life-history trade-offs.
Focuses on pleiotropic genes with beneficial early-life but detrimental late-life effects driving aging.
Describes genetic trade-offs between reproduction and longevity mediated by pleiotropic genes.
Explains age-specific decline in stress phenotypes caused by antagonistic pleiotropy and mutation accumulation.
Summarizes antagonistic pleiotropy as genes beneficial early but harmful later, causing aging.
Details gene vgll3 regulating growth, maturity, and aging via antagonistic pleiotropy with late-life costs.
Studies age-dependent trade-offs between reproduction and survival consistent with antagonistic pleiotropy.
Integrates biological constraints and programmatic aging with antagonistic pleiotropy as evolutionary cause of aging.
Focuses on protein synthesis and TOR pathway mediating growth-longevity trade-offs as a molecular mechanism of antagonistic pleiotropy.
Describes telomerase dual role in cancer risk early and tissue maintenance late, embodying antagonistic pleiotropy.
Shows reduced extrinsic mortality and strong purifying selection in ant queens, linking eusociality to aging mechanisms.
Reduced extrinsic mortality via symbiosis in clownfish leads to longevity evolution, similar to eusocial protection effects.
Mathematical modeling of aging inevitability due to evolutionary trade-offs consistent with antagonistic pleiotropy.
Decline of natural selection with age allows late-acting deleterious genes to persist, a key concept in antagonistic pleiotropy.
Evolutionary theory of senescence explaining age-related fitness declines via evolutionary trade-offs and antagonistic pleiotropy.
Links development and aging through conserved genetic pathways, consistent with antagonistic pleiotropy mechanisms.
Evolution of eusociality and lifespan extension in Hymenoptera driven by social structure and reproductive division of labor.
Shows aging favored under assortative mating and pathogen pressure, linking reproduction and survival trade-offs.
